why_list: [Pending Translation] Faster website loading times improve user experience and SEO

quality_list: [Pending Translation] 100% - No compression, original quality (largest file size)
[Pending Translation] 80-90% - High quality, minimal visible difference (recommended for most uses)
[Pending Translation] 60-80% - Good quality, noticeable compression at high zoom
[Pending Translation] 40-60% - Medium quality, visible artifacts but acceptable for web
[Pending Translation] 10-40% - Low quality, significant quality loss (smallest file size)
content.how_desc: [Pending Translation] Our tool uses advanced compression algorithms to reduce file size while preserving image quality. For JPG images, we use lossy compression that removes imperceptible details. For PNG, we optimize the color palette and use efficient encoding. All compression happens in your browser - your images never leave your device.
content.best_title: [Pending Translation] Best Practices for Image Compression
best_list: [Pending Translation] Start with high-quality original images for best results
[Pending Translation] Use 80-90% quality for web images - perfect balance of size and quality
[Pending Translation] Compress images before uploading to websites or social media
[Pending Translation] Use JPG for photos, PNG for graphics with transparency
[Pending Translation] Consider WebP format for modern browsers (smaller files)
[Pending Translation] Always preview compressed images before downloading
[Pending Translation] Keep original files as backup before compression
content.privacy_desc: [Pending Translation] All image compression happens entirely in your browser using JavaScript. Your images are never uploaded to our servers, ensuring complete privacy and security. Your files never leave your device.

jpg.title: [Pending Translation] JPG/JPEG
jpg.desc: [Pending Translation] Best for photographs and complex images with many colors. Lossy compression.

png.title: [Pending Translation] PNG
png.desc: [Pending Translation] Best for graphics, logos, and images with transparency. Lossless or lossy compression.

webp.title: [Pending Translation] WebP
webp.desc: [Pending Translation] Modern format with superior compression. Smaller files than JPG/PNG with same quality.

faq.q1: [Pending Translation] Will compressing images reduce quality?
faq.a1: [Pending Translation] Yes, but minimally. At 80-90% quality, the difference is imperceptible to the human eye. You can adjust the quality slider to find the perfect balance between file size and visual quality.
faq.q2: [Pending Translation] What's the difference between lossy and lossless compression?
faq.a2: [Pending Translation] Lossy compression (JPG) removes some image data to achieve smaller files, while lossless compression (PNG) reduces file size without losing any data. Lossy gives better compression but slight quality loss.
faq.q3: [Pending Translation] How much can I reduce image file size?
faq.a3: [Pending Translation] Typically 50-90% reduction depending on the original image and quality settings. Photos often compress more than graphics. WebP format provides the best compression.
faq.q4: [Pending Translation] Are my images uploaded to your server?
faq.a4: [Pending Translation] No! All compression happens in your browser using JavaScript. Your images never leave your device, ensuring complete privacy and security.
faq.q5: [Pending Translation] What image formats are supported?
faq.a5: [Pending Translation] We support JPG/JPEG, PNG, and WebP formats. These cover 99% of web images. The tool automatically detects the format and applies optimal compression.

content.title: [Pending Translation] WebP to JPG: The Compatibility Fixer
content.p1: [Pending Translation] WebP is fantastic for website speed, but it's a pain when you try to open it in Photoshop, older image viewers, or upload it to platforms that only accept JPG.
content.p2: [Pending Translation] Our WebP to JPG Converter bridges this gap. It takes your highly optimized WebP images and transforms them into the universally compatible JPEG format in milliseconds.

universal.title: [Pending Translation] Universal Support
universal.desc: [Pending Translation] JPG works everywhere: Word docs, PowerPoint, legacy software, and every social media platform.

secure.title: [Pending Translation] Secure Processing
secure.desc: [Pending Translation] We don't see your files. The conversion is performed locally by your web browser.

smart.title: [Pending Translation] Smart Backgrounds
smart.desc: [Pending Translation] Automatically detects transparent pixels in WebP and fills them with a clean white background.

how_to.title: [Pending Translation] Step-by-Step Guide
list: [Pending Translation] Click the box or drag your WebP image onto the page.
[Pending Translation] The tool will display a preview of your image.
[Pending Translation] Click the "Convert to JPG" button. The system handles transparency and compression automatically.
[Pending Translation] Your new .jpg file will download instantly.

why.title: [Pending Translation] Why Convert WebP?
list: [Pending Translation] Editing: Many desktop editors typically don't support WebP out of the box.
[Pending Translation] Email: Outlook and other email clients might not render WebP inline images correctly.
[Pending Translation] Printing: Print shops often require standard JPG or TIFF files.

faq.title: [Pending Translation] FAQ
faq.q1: [Pending Translation] What happens to transparent backgrounds?
faq.a1: [Pending Translation] Since JPG doesn't support transparency, our tool replaces transparent areas with white. This is perfect for product photos and logos.
faq.a2: [Pending Translation] Yes. Unlike other converters that upload your file to a server, this tool runs 100% on your device. Your data remains private.

js.invalid_image: [Pending Translation] Please upload a valid WEBP image
